thread.title: Confessions of a Free-Trade Lobbyist - WSJ
thread.title_full: Confessions of a Free-Trade Lobbyist - WSJ

author: Bill Lane
title: Confessions of a Free-Trade Lobbyist - WSJ
text:
Commentary Confessions of a Free-Trade Lobbyist Business leaders politely clap as the president puts exports at risk. Yet they know ‘Fortress America’ would be a disaster. By Bill Lane Updated Feb. 23, 2017 7:21 p.m. ET 
Time to come clean. During my 40-year career at Caterpillar, I don’t recall ever being in a management meeting where the sole objective was creating American jobs. No boss ever said, “Your annual review will only measure the number of U.S. workers added.” 
Mind you, I’ve been in countless meetings where the objective was increasing sales, reducing costs, improving quality, promoting safety or encouraging diversity. There were meetings that focused on embracing innovation or attracting and retaining the best employees. Some... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
